topic.title: MP5301.601 (a)(i) Department of the Air Force Approval Authority Matrices

body.p: MP5301.601 (a)(i) Department of the Air Force Approval Authority Matrices and MP5301.601 (a)(i) Department of the Air Force Approval Authority Matrices consist of delegations (or retentions) of authority made by the Department of the Air Force Agency Head (HoA), Senior Procurement Executive (SPE), Service Acquisition Executives (SAEs), and Head of Contracting Activities (HCAs). The Tables do not contain authorities originally invested somewhere other than those positions (e.g., certain class deviations which must be approved by DPC). MP5301.601 (a)(i) Department of the Air Force Approval Authority Matrices reflects the authority to enter into, approve, or terminate Grants, Cooperative Agreements, Other Transactions and Procurements for Experimental purposes—including the issuance of a warrant for such purposes.

p.b: MP5301.601 (a)(i) Department of the Air Force Approval Authority Matrices – SAF/AQ NON-SPACE SYSTEMS AND PROGRAMS:

body.p: SAF/AQ is authorized to execute HoA, SAE, and SPE responsibilities for non-space systems and programs, including product support, unless otherwise noted in regulations or policy. For non-space systems and programs, including product support SAF/AQC (Deputy Assistant Secretary (Contracting) or the Associate Deputy Assistant Secretary (Contracting)) is designated HCA. Documents requiring HCA approval by SAF/AQC shall be submitted through the SCO to the SAF/AQC Workflow. Approvals from SAF/AQ, SecAF, or DPC require coordination from SAF/AQC.

Packages submitted to SAF/AQ shall include an electronic Staff Summary Sheet (eSSS) in the body of the email or as an attachment (Word document only). Include any applicable documentation and list each attachment under “Tabs” on the eSSS using the exact electronic file name (e.g., ACE Acquisition Strategy) of the corresponding attachment. Changes recommended during the staffing process must be adjudicated by the contracting officer. Submit questions or concerns regarding processing packages that require SAF/AQ approval to SAF/AQC Workflow.

p.b: MP5301.601 (a)(i) Department of the Air Force Approval Authority Matrices SAF/SQ SPACE SYSTEMS AND PROGRAMS:

body.p: SAF/SQ is authorized to execute HoA, SAE, and certain SPE responsibilities for space systems and programs, unless otherwise noted in regulation or policy. For space related systems and programs, the SSC/PK Director, the Space Development Agency (SDA) Director, or Space RCO (SpRCO) Director of Contracting are designated HCAs. Submit documents requiring HCA coordination or approval to the cognizant HCA workflow identified in DAFFARS 5302.101. Approvals from SAF/AQ, SAF/SQ, DPC, or SecAF require coordination from the HCA.

NOTE
: Further Delegable Columns with “No” indicate retained responsibilities or those that are non-delegable or cannot be delegated further per regulation or statute. Further Delegable Columns with “Yes” require written delegations approved by the Delegated Authority reflected.

p.b: TABLE 1 SAF/AQ NON-SPACE SYSTEMS AND PROGRAMS (WHEN HCA IS SAF/AQC)

row.entry: Ratification of unauthorized commitments, subject to the limitations in FAR 1.602-3(c) at or above SAT.

entry.p: HCA unless agency designates higher level, further delegable no lower than COCO

row.entry: Ratification of unauthorized commitments, subject to the limitations in FAR 1.602-3(c) below SAT.
HCA unless agency designates higher level, further delegable no lower than COCO
Authority to enter into, approve, or terminate Grants, Cooperative Agreements, Other Transactions and Procurements for Experimental purposes—including the issuance of a warrant for such purposes.
Authority to enter into, approve, modify, and terminate contracts—including the issuance of a Contracting Officer warrant for such purposes.

Determines, after notice and hearing, that contractor or representative offered or gave a gratuity to officer, official, or Government employee and intended, by the gratuity, to obtain a contract or favorable treatment under a contract; and determines amount of exemplary damages (between 3 and 10 times cost incurred by contractor in giving gratuities to person concerned).
Approves agency supplementation of 3.104 including specific definitions to identify individuals who occupy positions specified in 3.104-3(d)(1)(ii), and any clauses required by 3.104.
SPE unless law establishes a higher level

Authorizes the disqualified official to resume participation in the procurement or determine that an additional disqualification period is necessary. (See DAFFARS 5303.104-5(c)(2) when the disqualified official is the SCO or the HCA).

Reviews and takes appropriate action on information that a reported violation or possible violation of a present or former government official or someone advising that official knowingly disclosed contractor bid or proposal information or source selection information before award.
SCO, only if GO or SES; otherwise, SAF/AQC
Grants waiver in the interest of national security that the prohibition period described in Paragraph (b) of clause 252.203-7001 may be less than 5 years.
Makes written determination that the prohibition period described in Paragraph (b) of clause 252.203-7001 may be more than 5 years.
Authorizes contract award to a Government employee or to a business concern owned or controlled by a Government employee and only if there is a most compelling reason to do so per FAR 3.602.
HoA or designee not below HCA

Considers, in addition to any penalty prescribed by law or regulation--suspension or debarment proceedings, voiding and rescinding contracts for a contractor convicted of any offense relating to contracts with the agency.
Takes required actions regarding reprisals as prohibited by 203.903 (10 USC 4701).

Determines in writing that such action in FAR 3.1104(a) is in the best interest of the Government (HCA may impose conditions that provide mitigation of a personal conflict of interest or grant a waiver).
Makes written determination that availability of a solicitation through the GPE is not in the Government's interest.

Makes written determination after consult with Administrator for Federal Procurement Policy and the Administrator of the Small Business Administration that advance notice of proposed contract action is not appropriate or reasonable.
Approves the publication of paid advertisements in newspapers.
Determines if agency can enter into contracts for studies, analyses, or consulting services on the basis of an unsolicited proposal without providing for full and open competition.
HCA or designee no lower than COCO
Approves waiver to post request for information or sources sought notices when using J&A authority FAR 6.302-1.
HCA or designee no lower than GO/FO/SES
SCO if GO or SES or MAJCOM SCO if GO or SES; otherwise, SAF/AQC

Approves a document (AFFARS prescribes use of International Agreement Competitive Restrictions (IACR)) that describes the terms of an agreement or treaty or written directions, such as a Letter of Offer and Acceptance, which have the effect of requiring the use of other than competitive procedures. J&A is not required.
Approves in writing the justification for other than full and open competition for proposed contracts over $100M.

Determines that consolidation is necessary and justified if the benefits of the acquisition would substantially exceed the benefits that would be derived from each of the alternative contracting approaches identified under paragraph (a)(2).

Determines that consolidation is necessary and justified when the expected benefits do not meet the thresholds for a substantial benefit at paragraph (d)(1) of this subsection but are critical to the agency's mission success; and the procurement strategy provides for maximum practicable participation by small business.
Makes written determination that the bundling is necessary and justified in accordance with 15 U.S.C. 644(e) after ensuring that conditions at (a)-(e) are met.

Determines that bundling is necessary and justified when the expected benefits do not meet the thresholds for a substantial benefit but are critical to the agency's mission success; and the procurement strategy provides for maximum practicable participation by small business.
Approves acquisition for vessel/aircraft/vehicle through a lease/charter/similar agreement for 18 months or more.
Approves D&F when the total performance period, including options, of a T&M/LH order is more than three years.
Yes, no lower than the COCO
Determination (in writing) to award single-award Blanket Purchase Agreement with an estimated value exceeding $100 million (including any options).
Makes written determination that access through e-Buy not in Government's interest.
Approves the justification for limited sources under a BPA with an estimated value over $100M.
Is the designee referenced in FAR 9.202(a) (inclusion of other qualification requirements).
Yes, no lower than the COCO
Is the designee referenced in FAR 9.206-1(b) (enforcing qualification requirements).
Approves a contract for procurement, modification, repair, or overhaul of an aviation critical safety item with a source approved by the head of the design control activity.
Yes, no lower than the COCO
Determines compelling reason exists to solicit offers from, award contracts to, or consent to subcontracts with contractor debarred, suspended, or proposed for debarment.
Grants exemption permitting award to contractor that has violation of Clean Air or Clean Water Act.
HoA, delegable no lower than GO or SES
Makes written determination of the compelling reason to consider bid received from, evaluate for award, include in competitive range or hold discussions with listed contractor.
Directs discontinuance of contracts or subcontracts in existence at time contractor was debarred, suspended, or proposed for debarment.

For contractors debarred, suspended, or proposed for debarment, makes written determination of the compelling reasons to place orders exceeding the guaranteed minimum; place orders under FSS, BPAs, or BOAs; or add new work, exercise options, or otherwise extend duration or current contracts or orders.

States in writing that compelling reason exists for CO to consent to proposed subcontracts with contractors debarred, suspended, or proposed for debarment, or that the Secretary of Defense has identified in SAM Exclusions as being owned or controlled by the government of a country that is a state sponsor of terrorism.
Waives FAR 9.5 requirements -- Organizational and Consultant Conflicts of Interest (OCI).
Determines an exception to Limitation on Future Contracting in systems engineering and technical assistance contracts is necessary.

Require offerors to demonstrate that items offered have (1) either achieved market acceptance or been satisfactorily supplied to an agency under current or recent contracts for the same or similar requirements, and (2) otherwise meet the item description, specifications, or other criteria prescribed in the public notice and solicitation.

Determines the items are to be used to support a contingency or humanitarian or peacekeeping operation; to facilitate defense against or recovery from nuclear, biological, chemical, or radiological attack; to facilitate the provision of international disaster assistance; or to support response to an emergency or major disaster and, therefore, contractor not required to provide DoD IUID.

Executes D&F that it is more cost effective for the Government to assign, mark, and register the unique item identifier after delivery, & item acquired from SB concern or is commercial acquired under FAR Part 12 or 8 for an ACAT I program.

Executes D&F that it is more cost effective for the Government to assign, mark, and register the unique item identifier after delivery, & item acquired from SB concern or is commercial acquired under FAR Part 12 or 8 for all other programs.
Waives or reduces the amount of liquidated damages assessed under a contract if Commissioner, Financial Management Service, or designee approves (see Treasury Order 145-10).

If the contracting officer challenges an existing commercial product or commercial service determination, either confirm the prior determination was appropriate and still applicable, or issue a determination that the prior use of FAR Part 12 procedures was improper, or no longer appropriate, with a written explanation for the basis of the determination.

entry.p: For any class D&F, approves written determination by the contracting officer to use T&M or LH for commercial services contracts.

row.entry: HoA IAW Class Deviation until rescinded & PM 20-C-09 as incorporated

entry.p: For an individual D&F if the base period plus any option period exceeds 3 years regardless of T&M/LH value, or if the T&M/LH value exceeds $10M, approves written determination by the contracting officer to use T&M or LH for commercial services contracts.

row.entry: HoA IAW Class Deviation until rescinded & PM 20-C-09/-10 as incorporated

entry.p: For an individual D&F if the base period plus any option period is 3 years or less & the T&M/LH value is less than or equal to $10M, approves written determination by the contracting officer to use T&M or LH for commercial services contracts.

row.entry: HoA IAW Class Deviation until rescinded & PM 20-C-09/-10 as incorporated

For contracts above $10M, determines no commercial services are suitable to meet the agency’s needs for facilities related services, knowledge-based services (e.g., Advisory and Assistance Services excluding engineering services), medical services, or transportation services.
Yes, no lower than the COCO
Waiver authority for tailoring provisions and clauses for acquisition of commercial products and commercial services under FAR 12.302(c).
Waives the requirement for inclusion of FAR clauses 52.214-27 and 52.214-28 in a contract with a foreign government or agency of that government.
Make administrative determinations in connection with mistakes in bids alleged after opening of bids and before award.
Waives requirements of DoD Source Selection Procedures paragraph 1.2 for solicitations valued between $10M and $1B

Waives the requirement at DFARS 215.371-2 to resolicit for an additional period of at least 30 days when only one offer is received as a result of a compe`titive solicitation allowing fewer than 30 days for receipt of proposals.
HCA – no lower than 1-level above CO
Yes, no lower than the COCO

entry.p: Determines certified cost or pricing data should be required based on past performance or other information specific to the award.

row.entry: Waives requirement for submission of certified cost or pricing data in exceptional cases.

entry.p: Approves determination to make award without offeror submission of data other than certified cost or pricing data.

row.entry: HCA, delegable no lower than one level above CO

entry.p: Provides quarterly information within 25 days following the end of the quarter using Contractor Denials of Data Requests.

row.entry: Authorizes CO to obtain certified cost or pricing data for actions below the threshold in FAR 15.403-4(a)(1), provided the action exceeds the SAT.
Determines that auditing of records should be required based on past performance or other information specific to the award.
Approves the use of the alternate structured approach for Profit (see DFARS 215.404-73).
Yes, no lower than the COCO
Waives on a case-by-case basis, the use of forward pricing rate agreement (FPRA) rates when such rates are available.
Requests an overhead should-cost review for a contractor business unit that does not meet the criteria found in DFARS PGI 215.407-4(c)(2)(A).

Approve determination (when contracting with the Canadian Commercial Corporation) that data other than certified cost or pricing data are needed in order to determine that the price is fair and reasonable.
HCA or designee no lower than 2-lvls above the CO
Yes, no lower than 2-levels above the CO

Approve determination (when contracting with the Canadian Commercial Corporation) that it is reasonably certain that data other than certified cost or pricing data will be needed in order to determine that the price of modifications is fair and reasonable.

entry.p: HCA or designee no lower than 2-lvls above the CO

row.entry: Yes, no lower than 2-levels above the CO
Approves the use of a fixed-ceiling-price contract with retroactive price redetermination.
HCA or higher if required by agency
Approves D&F to justify that the use of an award-fee contract is in the best interest of the government.
HCA or designee no lower than 1 level below the HCA
Approves D&F to justify that the use of an incentive contract is in the best interest of the government.
HCA or designee no lower than 1-lvl above the CO
Yes, no lower than 1-level above the CO
Designate the Fee Determining Official on an individual contract or class basis. This designation may be made by name, position, or function, without limitation.
FDO unless otherwise authorized in agency procedures
PEO for PEO designated programs or SCO for all other programs
Approves setting the percentage of award fee available for the final evaluation below 40 percent if the contracting officer determines that a lower percentage is appropriate.
Approves the justification for exceptions to fair opportunity for a proposed order over $100M.
Approves a D&F that a listed exception applies.
Approves the determination of a reasonable price or fee if the CO & contractor fail to reach agreement.
Determines a letter contract may be used if no other contract type is suitable.
Yes, below $50M but no lower than the COCO
Enters into a multi-year contract (MYC) for supplies (DoD) if conditions at (b)(1)-(5) are met.
Authorizes the use of a solicitation requesting only multi-year prices, provided that dual proposals are not necessary to meet the objectives in FAR 17.105-2.
Approves the use of variable unit prices on multi-year contracts provided that, for competitive proposals, there is a valid method of evaluation.
Provides written notice to the congressional defense committees at least 30 days before termination of any MYC.
Makes written determination before entering into a MYC that the conditions at (c)(1)-(3) are met.
Determines the conditions required by DFARS 217.172(h)(2)(i)-(vii) will be met by a multi-year contract equal to or greater than $750M.

Enters into a MYC for a weapon system pursuant to DFARS 217.172(g)(1) or advance procurement of components, parts, and materials necessary to manufacture a weapon system pursuant to DFARS 217.172 (g)(2)
Ensures that the conditions at (h)(1)-(7) are satisfied before awarding a MYC for a defense acquisition program that has been specifically authorized by law to be carried out using MYC authority.
Enters into aMYC for up to 4 years (for supplies and services required for management, maintenance, and operation of military family housing) and pay for each year from annual appropriations.

Determines, on the basis of a business case analysis, that the proposed purchase of electricity from sources of renewable energy under such contract is cost effective; and it would not be possible to purchase electricity from the source in an economical manner without the use of a contract for a period in excess of five years.
Determines in writing that exceptional circumstances require an ordering period that exceeds 10 years.

entry.p: Approves issuance of an order subject to 217.204(e)(i) if performance under the order is expected to extend more than 1 year beyond the 10-yr limit or extended limit described in (e)(i)(C).

row.entry: Approves D&F for an Economy Act order to obtain supplies or services by interagency acquisition when the servicing agency is not covered by the FAR.
Determine in writing that it is necessary in the interest of DoD to acquire supplies and services through the nondefense agency during the fiscal year, absent certification required by 17.703(a).

Approves Undefinitized Contract Actions (UCA), to include Foreign Military Sales & including requirements for non-urgent spare parts and support equipment in a UCA; or modifying the scope of a UCA when performance has already begun.
Yes, below $50M no lower than the COCO

entry.p: Approves unilateral definitizations by the Contracting Officer (in writing) for UCAs with a value greater than $50M.

entry.p: Approves unilateral definitizations by the Contracting Officer (in writing) for UCAs with a value of $50M or below.

row.entry: Yes, no lower than the COCO
Determines in writing that extending definitization beyond an additional 90 days is in the best interest of the Government.

Waives limitations of 217.7404(a) Foreign military sales contracts; 217.7404-2 Price ceiling; 217.7404-3 Definitization schedule; and 217.7404-4 Limitations of obligations, if necessary to support cont. ops or humanitarian/peacekeeping op.
Contracting Officer submits certification for a replenishment part price increase that increased by 25 percent or more over the most recent 12-month period to the appropriate authority.
Determines that the contracting process may continue after GAO has received a protest (See FAR 33.104(b) and (c)).

Determines that micro-purchases and simplified acquisitions of supplies or services (or the supplies or services themselves as applicable) are to be used in support of a contingency operation; to facilitate defense against or recovery from cyber, nuclear, biological, chemical, or radiological attack; to facilitate the provision of international disaster assistance; or to support response to an emergency or major disaster.
Implements small business programs within their activities, achieve program goals, and ensure contracting personnel maintain knowledge of program requirements.
Assigns small business technical advisors to perform this function in accordance with DFARS 219.201(c)(8).
Renders a decision regarding the CO’s rejection of an SBA recommendation.
Yes, no lower than the COCO
Determines not to suspend action on the acquisition because urgent and compelling circumstances exist.
Determines not to suspend action. Replies to SBA after receipt of a formal appeal from SBA concerning rejection of a set-aside for Service-disabled Veteran-owned Small Business.

entry.p: Issues a written determination on SBA’s appeal of the CO rejection of SBA’s PCR recommendation.

row.entry: Makes a written determination that urgent and compelling circumstances which significantly affect the interests of the United States compel award of the contract.
Specifies in writing the reasons for a denial of an SBA formal appeal.
Designates programs for contractors to notify Government of actual or potential labor disputes.
Yes, no lower than the COCO
Submits impact reports on labor disputes to agency head when sufficient urgency warrants the attention of the agency head or when specifically requested.
For construction contracts, submits Semiannual Enforcement Reports to the labor advisor.

Approves an urgent or critical award, without pre-award clearance from the Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP), if OFCCP cannot complete the evaluation by required date. Applies for contracts/subcontracts $10M or more excluding construction.
Waives the E-Verify requirement for a contract or subcontract or a class of contracts or subcontracts, either temporarily or for the period of performance.
Waives the requirements of 222.7002 on case-by-case basis for national security.
Waives the mandatory requirements for safety precautions for ammunition and explosives.

entry.p: Determines that domestic preference for foreign end product would be inconsistent with the public interest for acquisitions valued at or below SAT.

row.entry: Determines that domestic preference for foreign end product would be inconsistent with the public interest for acquisitions with a value greater than SAT but less than $1.5M.
Determines that domestic preference for foreign end product would be inconsistent with the public interest for acquisitions valued $1.5M or more.

entry.p: SAF/AQC for other than ACAT I Programs

row.entry: Approves determination that an article/material/supply is not mined, produced, or manufactured in the United States in sufficient and reasonably available commercial quantities of a satisfactory quality for acquisitions valued at or below SAT.

Approves determination that an article/material/supply is not mined, produced, or manufactured in the United States in sufficient and reasonably available commercial quantities of a satisfactory quality for acquisitions with a value greater than the SAT but less than $1.5M.

Approves determination that an article/material/supply is not mined, produced, or manufactured in the United States in sufficient and reasonably available commercial quantities of a satisfactory quality for acquisitions valued at $1.5M or more.
Determines that application of the restrictions of the Buy American statute to a particular construction material would be impracticable or would be inconsistent with the public interest.

entry.p: SAF/AQC for other than ACAT I Programs

Buy American Exception. Approves determination that a particular construction material is not mined, produced, or manufactured in the United States in sufficient and reasonably available commercial quantities of a satisfactory quality for acquisitions valued above SAT.

entry.p: Buy American Exception. Approves determination that a particular construction material is not mined, produced, or manufactured in the United States in sufficient and reasonably available commercial quantities of a satisfactory quality for acquisitions valued at or below SAT.

row.entry: Yes, no lower than 1-level above the CO

Specifies a higher percentage than 20 percent that the CO adds to the offered price of any foreign construction material proposed for exception from the requirements of the Buy American statute based on the unreasonable cost of domestic construction materials.

entry.p: SAF/AQC for other than ACAT I Programs

row.entry: Approves a national interest waiver for a purchase by an overseas purchasing activity if the product is critical for the support of U.S. forces stationed abroad.

American Recovery and Reinvestment Act-Buy American Statute-Construction Materials. Approves determination that a particular construction material is not mined, produced, or manufactured in the United States in sufficient and reasonably available commercial quantities of a satisfactory quality for acquisitions with a value greater than SAT.
Yes, but no lower than the COCO

American Recovery and Reinvestment Act-Buy American Statute-Construction Materials. Yes, no lower than 1-level above the CO

Determines that application of the restrictions of section 1605 of the Recovery Act to a particular manufactured construction material, or the restrictions of the Buy American statute to a particular unmanufactured construction material would be inconsistent with the public interest.

entry.p: SAF/AQC for other than ACAT I Programs

row.entry: Determines that application of the Buy American statute to a particular unmanufactured construction material would be impracticable.

entry.p: SAF/AQC for other than ACAT I Programs

row.entry: When a determination is made, for any of the reasons stated in FAR 25.603, that certain foreign construction materials may be used, provides a notice to the Federal Register within three business days after the determination of the inapplicability of Section 1605 of the Recovery Act is made, with a copy to the Administrator for Federal Procurement Policy and to the Recovery Accountability and Transparency Board.
Executes D&F in accordance with 25.1001(b), that use of 52.215-2 w/Alt III or 52.212-5 w/Alt I will best serve interest of the United States.
Waives restrictions on certain foreign purchases under 10 U.S.C. 4864.

Determines that the disclosure requirements regarding use of facilities and employment of individuals who perform work in the People’s Republic of China would not be in the national security interests of the US.
Any time during the acquisition process, determines that it is not in the public interest to apply the restrictions of the Balance of Payments Program to the end product or construction material.

entry.p: Makes written determination that it is in the national security interest of the US to use a procedure in 225.7703-1(a) for products or services not limited to use by the military forces, police, or other security personnel of Afghanistan (individual action D&F with a value of less than $100M).

row.entry: Makes written determination that it is in the national security interest of the US to use a procedure in 225.7703-1(a) for products or services not limited to use by the military forces, police, or other security personnel of Afghanistan (value of $100M or more) or to a class of acquisitions.
Determines in writing that transition to local firms is not feasible or practicable (individual or class basis).
Approves to exempt U.S. patents from the patent indemnity clause.

In contracts with small business concerns or nonprofits, approves and signs written justification allowing Government to require licensing to 3rd parties of inventions. May only authorize if (1) Use of the invention by others is necessary for the practice of a subject invention or for the use of a work object of the contract; and (2) Action is necessary to achieve the practical application of the subject invention or work object.
HoA – may not delegate this authority
Approves using other types of bonds when acquiring particular supplies or services.
Yes, no lower than the COCO
Approves the use of a new surety bond during the performance of the contract.
Yes, no lower than the COCO
Provides a certified copy of the payment bond and the contract in accordance with FAR 28.106-6(c); including determining the reasonable and appropriate costs the requestor must pay.
Yes, no lower than the CO
Waives the requirement for use of FAR clause 52.228-7, Insurance -- Liability to Third Persons.
Disallows the contractor to buy insurance for war-hazard losses. If so, the CO shall insert the clause at DFARS 252.228-7000.
Waive CAS applicability in accordance with the conditions at FAR 30.205-5(b).
HoA, delegable no lower than senior contract policy making level
Authorizes award of a CAS-covered contract w/o obtaining submission of the required disclosure statement.

Determine that incurrence of the Contribution in Aid of Construction (CIAC) tax is necessary to achieve the most beneficial business case for the Government and allowing the CIAC tax will result in significant benefits to the Government that outweigh the cost of allowing the tax.
Approves commercial product/service unusual contract financing
Determines, based on written findings, that advance payment is in public interest or facilitates national defense.
Makes determination, after consultation with the cognizant comptroller, that conditions exist that limit normal business operations.

Determines that (1) making invoice and contract financing payments earlier than 7 days prior to the dates specified in the contract is warranted in a specific case; or (2) use of accelerated payment methods described in 5 CFR §1315.5 is necessary.

Authorizes electronic funds transfer (EFT) for a non-domestic transaction if (1) the political, financial, and communications infrastructure in the foreign country supports EFT payment; or (2) payments of other than United States currency may be made safely.
At the request of the contractor, reviews agency records associated with a request for reimbursement of protest costs by the Government.
Yes, no lower than the COCO
Authorizes contract award notwithstanding a GAO protest before award, or continued contract performance notwithstanding a GAO protest after award.
Reports to the GAO why their recommendations have not been followed by the agency not later than 5 days after the expiration of the 60-day response period.
Determines that continued performance is necessary pending resolution of any claim that might arise under or be related to the contract.
Yes, no lower than 1-level above CO
Determines the information submitted is not sufficient to determine the reasonableness of price for items developed exclusively at private expense.
Approves special use allowance for research facility acquired by educational institutions.
Approves requests for indemnification of unusually hazardous risks under 10 U.S.C. 3861.

Yes, no lower than the COCO

Certifies that the additional expenditures are necessary to protect the National interest AND establishes a reasonable completion date for the project (Approval to expedite the completion date of a contract funded by a MILCON appropriations act, if additional costs are involved).

entry.p: (1) Authorizes the use of prequalification for urgent or complex construction projects; and
(2) Approves the prequalification procedures of construction sources.

Services must be urgent, cannot be obtained by other means, and are supporting DoD activities or programs outside the U.S.
May waive the 31.205-6(g)(6) cost allowability limitations on severance payments to foreign nationals that meet the conditions at 37.113-1(a)(1)-(2).
Determines if sufficient personnel with the requisite training and capabilities are available within the agency to perform the evaluation or analysis or proposals submitted for the acquisition.

Yes, no lower than the COCO

Yes, no lower than the COCO

Yes, no lower than the COCO

Yes, no lower than the COCO
Approves the solicitation of voluntary refunds from a contractor.

Waives limitations of 243.204-70-2 (price ceiling); 243.204-70-3 (definitization schedule); and 243.204-70-4 (limitations on obligations) if necessary to support cont. ops or humanitarian/peacekeeping op.
Raises or lowers the $25 million contractor purchasing system review (CPSR) level if considered to be in the Government's best interest.
Determines installation or construction of Government property on contractor-owned real property in such a fashion as to become non-severable is necessary and in the Government’s interest.
Determines contractor will not be required to tag, label, or mark items that are to be in support of contingency operation or to facilitate defense against/recovery from NBCR attack.

Executes D&F concluding that it is more cost effective for the Government requiring activity to assign, mark, and register the unique item identification after delivery of an item acquired from a small business concern or a commercial product acquired under FAR part 12 or part 8 for an ACAT I program.

Approves a determination and findings concluding that it is more cost effective for the Government requiring activity to assign, mark, and register the unique item identification after delivery of an item acquired from a small business concern or a commercial product acquired under FAR part 12 or part 8 for all other programs.
Approves use of Government property for commercial use expected to exceed 25 percent of the total use of Government and commercial work performed.
Yes, no lower than the COCO
Determines if the cost of calculating and tracking collateral savings will exceed the benefits to be derived.
Yes, no lower than the COCO
Approves the use of 252.249-7000, Special Termination Costs in incrementally funded contract.

p.b: TABLE 2 SAF/SQ SPACE SYSTEMS AND PROGRAMS (WHEN HCA IS SSC/PK, SDA DIRECTOR, OR SPRCO DIRECTOR OF CONTRACTING)

row.entry: Ratification of unauthorized commitments, subject to the limitations in FAR 1.602-3(c) at or above SAT.
HCA unless agency designates higher level, further delegable no lower than COCO
Ratification of unauthorized commitments, subject to the limitations in FAR 1.602-3(c) below SAT.
HCA unless agency designates higher level, further delegable no lower than COCO
Authority to enter into, approve, or terminate Grants, Cooperative Agreements, Other Transactions and Procurements for Experimental purposes—including the issuance of a warrant for such purposes.
Authority to enter into, approve, modify, and terminate contracts—including the issuance of a Contracting Officer warrant for such purposes.
Approves agency supplementation of 3.104 including specific definitions to identify individuals who occupy positions specified in 3.104-3(d)(1)(ii), and any clauses required by 3.104.
SPE unless law establishes a higher level

Authorizes the disqualified official to resume participation in the procurement or determine that an additional disqualification period is necessary. (See DAFFARS 5303.104-5(c)(2) when the disqualified official is the SCO or the HCA).

Reviews and takes appropriate action on information that a reported violation or possible violation of a present or former government official or someone advising that official knowingly disclosed contractor bid or proposal information or source selection information before award.
HCA, further delegable no lower than COCO (must be SES or flag officer)
SCO, only if GO or SES; otherwise, HCA

Determines, after notice and hearing, that contractor or representative offered or gave a gratuity to officer, official, or Government employee and intended, by the gratuity, to obtain a contract or favorable treatment under a contract; and determines amount of exemplary damages (between 3 and 10 times cost incurred by contractor in giving gratuities to person concerned).
Grants waiver in the interest of national security that the prohibition period described in Paragraph (b) of clause 252.203-7001 may be less than 5 years.
Makes written determination that the prohibition period described in Paragraph (b) of clause 252.203-7001 may be more than 5 years.
Authorizes contract award to a Government employee or to a business concern owned or controlled by a Government employee and only if there is a most compelling reason to do so per FAR 3.602.
HoA or designee not below HCA

Considers, in addition to any penalty prescribed by law or regulation, initiating suspension or debarment proceedings and voiding and rescinding contracts for a contractor convicted of any offense relating to contracts with the agency.
Takes required actions regarding reprisals as prohibited by 203.903 (10 USC 4701).

Determines in writing that such action in FAR 3.1104(a) is in the best interest of the Government (HCA may impose conditions that provide mitigation of a personal conflict of interest or grant a waiver).
Makes written determination that availability of a solicitation through the GPE is not in the Government's interest.

entry.p: Makes written determination after consult with Administrator for Federal Procurement Policy and the Administrator of the Small Business Administration that advance notice of proposed contract action is not appropriate or reasonable.

row.entry: Approves the publication of paid advertisements in newspapers.
Determines if agency can enter into contracts for studies, analyses, or consulting services on the basis of an unsolicited proposal without providing for full and open competition.
HCA or designee no lower than COCO
Approves waiver to post request for information or sources sought notices when using J&A authority FAR 6.302-1.
HCA or designee no lower than GO/FO/SES
SCO if GO or SES; otherwise, HCA

Approves a document (DAFFARS prescribes use of International Agreement Competitive Restrictions (IACR)) that describes the terms of an agreement or treaty or written directions, such as a Letter of Offer and Acceptance, which have the effect of requiring the use of other than competitive procedures. J&A is not required.
Approves in writing the justification for other than full and open competition for proposed contracts over $100M.

Determines that consolidation is necessary and justified if the benefits of the acquisition would substantially exceed the benefits that would be derived from each of the alternative contracting approaches identified under paragraph (a)(2).

Determines that consolidation is necessary and justified when the expected benefits do not meet the thresholds for a substantial benefit at paragraph (d)(1) of this subsection but are critical to the agency's mission success; and the procurement strategy provides for maximum practicable participation by small business.
Makes written determination that the bundling is necessary and justified in accordance with 15 U.S.C. 644(e) after ensuring that conditions at (a)-(e) are met.

Determines that bundling is necessary and justified when the expected benefits do not meet the thresholds for a substantial benefit but are critical to the agency's mission success; and the procurement strategy provides for maximum practicable participation by small business.
Approves acquisition for vessel/aircraft/vehicle through a lease/charter/similar agreement for 18 months or more.
Approves D&F when the total performance period, including options, of a T&M/LH order is more than three years.
Determination (in writing) to award single-award Blanket Purchase Agreement with an estimated value exceeding $100 million (including any options).
Makes written determination that access through e-Buy not in Government's interest.
Approves the justification for limited sources under a BPA with an estimated value over $100M.
Is the designee referenced in FAR 9.202(a) (inclusion of other qualification requirements).
Is the designee referenced in FAR 9.206-1(b) (enforcing qualification requirements).
Approves a contract for procurement, modification, repair, or overhaul of an aviation critical safety item with a source approved by the head of the design control activity.
Determines compelling reason exists to solicit offers from, award contracts to, or consent to subcontracts with contractor debarred, suspended, or proposed for debarment.
Grants exemption permitting award to contractor that has violation of Clean Air or Clean Water Act.
HoA, delegable no lower than GO or SES
Makes written determination of the compelling reason to consider bid received from, evaluate for award, include in competitive range or hold discussions with listed contractor.
Directs discontinuance of contracts or subcontracts in existence at time contractor was debarred, suspended, or proposed for debarment.

For contractors debarred, suspended, or proposed for debarment, makes written determination of the compelling reasons to place orders exceeding the guaranteed minimum; place orders under FSS, BPAs, or BOAs; or add new work, exercise options, or otherwise extend duration or current contracts or orders.

States in writing that compelling reason exists for CO to consent to proposed subcontracts with contractors debarred, suspended, or proposed for debarment, or that the Secretary of Defense has identified in SAM Exclusions as being owned or controlled by the government of a country that is a state sponsor of terrorism.
Waives FAR 9.5 requirements -- Organizational and Consultant Conflicts of Interest (OCI).
Determines an exception to Limitation on Future Contracting in systems engineering and technical assistance contracts is necessary.

entry.p: Require offerors to demonstrate that items offered have (1) either achieved market acceptance or been satisfactorily supplied to an agency under current or recent contracts for the same or similar requirements, and (2) otherwise meet the item description, specifications, or other criteria prescribed in the public notice and solicitation.

row.entry: Determines the items are to be used to support a contingency or humanitarian or peacekeeping operation; to facilitate defense against or recovery from nuclear, biological, chemical, or radiological attack; to facilitate the provision of international disaster assistance; or to support response to an emergency or major disaster and, therefore, contractor not required to provide DoD IUID.

Executes D&F that it is more cost effective for the Government to assign, mark, and register the unique item identifier after delivery, & item acquired from SB concern or is commercial acquired under FAR Part 12 or 8 for an ACAT I program.

Executes D&F that it is more cost effective for the Government to assign, mark, and register the unique item identifier after delivery, & item acquired from SB concern or is commercial acquired under FAR Part 12 or 8 for all other programs.
Waives or reduces the amount of liquidated damages assessed under a contract if Commissioner, Financial Management Service, or designee approves (see Treasury Order 145-10).

If the contracting officer challenges an existing commercial product or commercial service determination, either confirm the prior determination was appropriate and still applicable, or issue a determination that the prior use of FAR Part 12 procedures was improper, or no longer appropriate, with a written explanation for the basis of the determination.

entry.p: For any class D&F, approves written determination by the contracting officer to use T&M or LH for commercial services contracts.

row.entry: HoA IAW Class Deviation until rescinded & PM 20-C-09 as incorporated

entry.p: For an individual D&F if the base period plus any option period exceeds 3 years regardless of T&M/LH value, or if the T&M/LH value exceeds $10M, approves written determination by the contracting officer to use T&M or LH for commercial services contracts.

row.entry: HoA IAW Class Deviation until rescinded & PM 20-C-09/-10 as incorporated

entry.p: For an individual D&F if the base period plus any option period is 3 years or less & the T&M/LH value is less than or equal to $10M, approves written determination by the contracting officer to use T&M or LH for commercial services contracts.

row.entry: HoA IAW Class Deviation until rescinded & PM 20-C-09/-10 as incorporated

For contracts above $10M, determines no commercial services are suitable to meet the agency’s needs for facilities related services, knowledge-based services (e.g., Advisory and Assistance Services excluding engineering services), medical services, or transportation services.
Waiver authority for tailoring provisions and clauses for acquisition of commercial products and commercial services under FAR 12.302(c).
Waives the requirement for inclusion of FAR clauses 52.214-27 and 52.214-28 in a contract with a foreign government or agency of that government.

entry.p: Make administrative determinations in connection with mistakes in bids alleged after opening of bids and before award.

row.entry: Waives requirements of DoD Source Selection Procedures paragraph 1.2 for solicitations valued between $10M and $1B

Waives the requirement at DFARS 215.371-2 to resolicit for an additional period of at least 30 days when only one offer is received as a result of a competitive solicitation allowing fewer than 30 days for receipt of proposals.
HCA – no lower than 1-level above CO

entry.p: Determines certified cost or pricing data should be required based on past performance or other information specific to the award.

row.entry: Waives requirement for submission of certified cost or pricing data in exceptional cases.

entry.p: Approves determination to make award without offeror submission of data other than certified cost or pricing data.

row.entry: HCA, delegable to no lower than one level above CO

entry.p: Provides quarterly information within 25 days following the end of the quarter using Contractor Denials of Data Requests.

row.entry: Authorizes CO to obtain certified cost or pricing data for actions below the threshold in FAR 15.403-4(a)(1), provided the action exceeds the SAT.
Determines that auditing of records should be required based on past performance or other information specific to the award.
Approves the use of the alternate structured approach for Profit (see DFARS 215.404-73).
Waives on a case-by-case basis, the use of forward pricing rate agreement (FPRA) rates when such rates are available.
Requests an overhead should-cost review for a contractor business unit that does not meet the criteria found in DFARS PGI 215.407-4(c)(2)(A).

Approve determination (when contracting with the Canadian Commercial Corporation) that data other than certified cost or pricing data are needed in order to determine that the price is fair and reasonable.
HCA or designee no lower than 2-lvls above the CO

Approve determination (when contracting with the Canadian Commercial Corporation) that it is reasonably certain that data other than certified cost or pricing data will be needed in order to determine that the price of modifications is fair and reasonable.

entry.p: HCA or designee no lower than 2-lvls above the CO

row.entry: Approves the use of a fixed-ceiling-price contract with retroactive price redetermination.
HCA or higher if required by agency
Approves D&F to justify that the use of an award-fee contract is in the best interest of the government.
HCA or designee no lower than 1 level below the HCA
Approves D&F to justify that the use of an incentive contract is in the best interest of the government.
HCA or designee no lower than 1-lvl above the CO
Designate the Fee Determining Official on an individual contract or class basis. This designation may be made by name, position, or function, without limitation.
FDO unless otherwise authorized in agency procedures
PEO for PEO designated programs or SCO for all other programs
Approves setting the percentage of award fee available for the final evaluation below 40 percent if the contracting officer determines that a lower percentage is appropriate.
Approves the justification for exceptions to fair opportunity for a proposed order over $100M.

entry.p: Approves a D&F that a listed exception applies.

row.entry: Approves the determination of a reasonable price or fee if the CO & contractor fail to reach agreement.
Determines a letter contract may be used if no other contract type is suitable.
SCO if $50M or greater, COCO if less than $50M
Enters into a multi-year contract (MYC) for supplies (DoD) if conditions at (b)(1)-(5) are met.
Authorizes the use of a solicitation requesting only multi-year prices, provided that dual proposals are not necessary to meet the objectives in FAR 17.105-2.
Approves the use of variable unit prices on multi-year contracts provided that, for competitive proposals, there is a valid method of evaluation.
Provides written notice to the congressional defense committees at least 30 days before termination of any MYC.
Makes written determination before entering into a MYC that the conditions at (c)(1)-(3) are met.
Determines the conditions required by DFARS 217.172(h)(2)(i)-(vii) will be met by a multi-year contract equal to or greater than $750M.

Enters into a MYC for a weapon system pursuant to DFARS 217.172(g)(1) or advance procurement of components, parts, and materials necessary to manufacture a weapon system pursuant to DFARS 217.172 (g)(2)
Ensures that the conditions at (h)(1)-(7) are satisfied before awarding a MYC for a defense acquisition program that has been specifically authorized by law to be carried out using MYC authority.
Enters into aMYC for up to 4 years (for supplies and services required for management, maintenance, and operation of military family housing) and pay for each year from annual appropriations.

Determines, on the basis of a business case analysis, that the proposed purchase of electricity from sources of renewable energy under such contract is cost effective; and it would not be possible to purchase electricity from the source in an economical manner without the use of a contract for a period in excess of five years.
Determines in writing that exceptional circumstances require an ordering period that exceeds 10 years.

entry.p: Approves issuance of an order subject to 217.204(e)(i) if performance under the order is expected to extend more than 1 year beyond the 10-yr limit or extended limit described in (e)(i)(C).

row.entry: Approves D&F for an Economy Act order to obtain supplies or services by interagency acquisition when the servicing agency is not covered by the FAR.
Determine in writing that it is necessary in the interest of DoD to acquire supplies and services through the nondefense agency during the fiscal year, absent certification required by 17.703(a).

Approves Undefinitized Contract Actions (UCA), to include Foreign Military Sales & including requirements for non-urgent spare parts and support equipment in a UCA; or modifying the scope of a UCA when performance has already begun.
SCO if $50M or greater, COCO if less than $50M

entry.p: Approves unilateral definitizations by the Contracting Officer (in writing) for UCAs with a value greater than $50M.

row.entry: HCA w/o power of redelegation for any UCA value greater than $50M

entry.p: Approves unilateral definitizations by the Contracting Officer (in writing) for UCAs with a value of $50M or below.

row.entry: Determines in writing that extending definitization beyond an additional 90 days is in the best interest of the Government.

Waives limitations of 217.7404(a) Foreign military sales contracts; 217.7404-2 Price ceiling; 217.7404-3 Definitization schedule; and 217.7404-4 Limitations of obligations, if necessary to support cont. ops or humanitarian/peacekeeping op.

entry.p: Contracting Officer submits certification for a replenishment part price increase that increased by 25 percent or more over the most recent 12-month period to the appropriate authority.

row.entry: Determines that the contracting process may continue after GAO has received a protest (See FAR 33.104(b) and (c)).

Determines that micro-purchases and simplified acquisitions of supplies or services (or the supplies or services themselves as applicable) are to be used in support of a contingency operation; to facilitate defense against or recovery from cyber, nuclear, biological, chemical, or radiological attack; to facilitate the provision of international disaster assistance; or to support response to an emergency or major disaster.
Implements small business programs within their activities, achieve program goals, and ensure contracting personnel maintain knowledge of program requirements.
Assigns small business technical advisors to perform this function in accordance with DFARS 219.201(c)(8).
Renders a decision regarding the CO’s rejection of an SBA recommendation.
Determines not to suspend action on the acquisition because urgent and compelling circumstances exist.
Determines not to suspend action. Replies to SBA after receipt of a formal appeal from SBA concerning rejection of a set-aside for Service-disabled Veteran-owned Small Business.

entry.p: Issues a written determination on SBA’s appeal of the CO rejection of SBA’s PCR recommendation.

row.entry: Makes a written determination that urgent and compelling circumstances which significantly affect the interests of the United States compel award of the contract.
Specifies in writing the reasons for a denial of an SBA formal appeal.
Designates programs for contractors to notify Government of actual or potential labor disputes.

entry.p: Submits impact reports on labor disputes to agency head when sufficient urgency warrants the attention of the agency head or when specifically requested.
For construction contracts, submits Semiannual Enforcement Reports to the labor advisor.

row.entry: Approves an urgent or critical award, without pre-award clearance from the Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP), if OFCCP cannot complete the evaluation by required date. Applies for contracts/subcontracts $10M or more excluding construction.
Waives the E-Verify requirement for a contract or subcontract or a class of contracts or subcontracts, either temporarily or for the period of performance.
Waives the requirements of 222.7002 on case-by-case basis for national security.
Waives the mandatory requirements for safety precautions for ammunition and explosives.

entry.p: Determines that domestic preference for foreign end product would be inconsistent with the public interest for acquisitions valued at or below SAT.

row.entry: Determines that domestic preference for foreign end product would be inconsistent with the public interest for acquisitions with a value greater than SAT but less than $1.5M.
Determines that domestic preference for foreign end product would be inconsistent with the public interest for acquisitions valued $1.5M or more.

entry.p: HCA for other than ACAT I Programs

row.entry: Approves determination that an article/material/supply is not mined, produced, or manufactured in the United States in sufficient and reasonably available commercial quantities of a satisfactory quality for acquisitions valued at or below SAT.

Approves determination that an article/material/supply is not mined, produced, or manufactured in the United States in sufficient and reasonably available commercial quantities of a satisfactory quality for acquisitions with a value greater than the SAT but less than $1.5M.

Approves determination that an article/material/supply is not mined, produced, or manufactured in the United States in sufficient and reasonably available commercial quantities of a satisfactory quality for acquisitions valued at $1.5M or more.
Determines that application of the restrictions of the Buy American statute to a particular construction material would be impracticable or would be inconsistent with the public interest.

entry.p: HCA for other than ACAT I Programs

Buy American Exception. Approves determination that a particular construction material is not mined, produced, or manufactured in the United States in sufficient and reasonably available commercial quantities of a satisfactory quality for acquisitions valued above SAT.

Buy American Exception. Approves determination that a particular construction material is not mined, produced, or manufactured in the United States in sufficient and reasonably available commercial quantities of a satisfactory quality for acquisitions valued at or below SAT.

row.entry: Specifies a higher percentage than 20 percent that the CO adds to the offered price of any foreign construction material proposed for exception from the requirements of the Buy American statute based on the unreasonable cost of domestic construction materials.

entry.p: HCA for other than ACAT I Programs

row.entry: Approves a national interest waiver for a purchase by an overseas purchasing activity if the product is critical for the support of U.S. forces stationed abroad.

American Recovery and Reinvestment Act-Buy American Statute-Construction Materials. Approves determination that a particular construction material is not mined, produced, or manufactured in the United States in sufficient and reasonably available commercial quantities of a satisfactory quality for acquisitions with a value greater than SAT.

American Recovery and Reinvestment Act-Buy American Statute-Construction Materials. Approves determination that a particular construction material is not mined, produced, or manufactured in the United States in sufficient and reasonably available commercial quantities of a satisfactory qualityfor acquisitions value at or below the SAT.

Determines that application of the restrictions of section 1605 of the Recovery Act to a particular manufactured construction material, or the restrictions of the Buy American statute to a particular unmanufactured construction material would be inconsistent with the public interest.

entry.p: HCA for other than ACAT I Programs

row.entry: Determines that application of the Buy American statute to a particular unmanufactured construction material would be impracticable.

entry.p: HCA for other than ACAT I Programs

row.entry: When a determination is made, for any of the reasons stated in FAR 25.603, that certain foreign construction materials may be used, provides a notice to the Federal Register within three business days after the determination of the inapplicability of Section 1605 of the Recovery Act is made, with a copy to the Administrator for Federal Procurement Policy and to the Recovery Accountability and Transparency Board.
Executes D&F in accordance with 25.1001(b), that use of 52.215-2 w/Alt III or 52.212-5 w/Alt I will best serve interest of the United States.
Waives restrictions on certain foreign purchases under 10 U.S.C. 4864.

Determines that the disclosure requirements regarding use of facilities and employment of individuals who perform work in the People’s Republic of China would not be in the national security interests of the US.
Any time during the acquisition process, determines that it is not in the public interest to apply the restrictions of the Balance of Payments Program to the end product or construction material.

entry.p: Makes written determination that it is in the national security interest of the US to use a procedure in 225.7703-1(a) for products or services not limited to use by the military forces, police, or other security personnel of Afghanistan (individual action D&F with a value of less than $100M).

row.entry: Makes written determination that it is in the national security interest of the US to use a procedure in 225.7703-1(a) for products or services not limited to use by the military forces, police, or other security personnel of Afghanistan (value of $100M or more) or to a class of acquisitions.
Determines in writing that transition to local firms is not feasible or practicable (individual or class basis).
Approves to exempt U.S. patents from the patent indemnity clause.

In contracts with small business concerns or nonprofits, approves and signs written justification allowing Government to require licensing to 3rd parties of inventions. May only authorize if (1) Use of the invention by others is necessary for the practice of a subject invention or for the use of a work object of the contract; and (2) Action is necessary to achieve the practical application of the subject invention or work object.
HoA – may not delegate this authority
Approves using other types of bonds when acquiring particular supplies or services.
Approves the use of a new surety bond during the performance of the contract.

entry.p: Provides a certified copy of the payment bond and the contract in accordance with FAR 28.106-6(c); including determining the reasonable and appropriate costs the requestor must pay.

row.entry: Waives the requirement for use of FAR clause 52.228-7, Insurance -- Liability to Third Persons.
Disallows the contractor to buy insurance for war-hazard losses. If so, the CO shall insert the clause at DFARS 252.228-7000.
Waive CAS applicability in accordance with the conditions at FAR 30.205-5(b).

entry.p: HoA, delegable no lower than senior contract policy making level

row.entry: Authorizes award of a CAS-covered contract w/o obtaining submission of the required disclosure statement.

Determine that incurrence of the Contribution in Aid of Construction (CIAC) tax is necessary to achieve the most beneficial business case for the Government and allowing the CIAC tax will result in significant benefits to the Government that outweigh the cost of allowing the tax.
Approves commercial product/service unusual contract financing.
Determines, based on written findings, that advance payment is in public interest or facilitates national defense.
Makes determination, after consultation with the cognizant comptroller, that conditions exist that limit normal business operations.

Determines that (1) making invoice and contract financing payments earlier than 7 days prior to the dates specified in the contract is warranted in a specific case; or (2) use of accelerated payment methods described in 5 CFR §1315.5 is necessary.

Authorizes electronic funds transfer (EFT) for a non-domestic transaction if (1) the political, financial, and communications infrastructure in the foreign country supports EFT payment; or (2) payments of other than United States currency may be made safely.
At the request of the contractor, reviews agency records associated with a request for reimbursement of protest costs by the Government.
Authorizes contract award notwithstanding a GAO protest before award, or continued contract performance notwithstanding a GAO protest after award.
Reports to the GAO why their recommendations have not been followed by the agency not later than 5 days after the expiration of the 60-day response period.
Determines that continued performance is necessary pending resolution of any claim that might arise under or be related to the contract.
Determines the information submitted is not sufficient to determine the reasonableness of price for items developed exclusively at private expense.
Approves special use allowance for research facility acquired by educational institutions.
Approves requests for indemnification of unusually hazardous risks under 10 U.S.C. 3861.
Approves concurrent performance of firm-fixed-price and other types of construction contracts at the same work site.
Approves contract awards for the construction of a project to the firm that designed the project or its subsidiaries or affiliates
Waives the requirement for pre-solicitation notices for proposed construction contracts expected to exceed the SAT.

Certifies that the additional expenditures are necessary to protect the National interest AND establishes a reasonable completion date for the project (Approval to expedite the completion date of a contract funded by a MILCON appropriations act, if additional costs are involved).

entry.p: (1) Authorizes the use of prequalification for urgent or complex construction projects; and
(2) Approves the prequalification procedures of construction sources.

row.entry: Establishes other criteria for use of two-phase design-build selection procedures.
Approves determination to allow more than five offerors to submit phase two design-build proposals for acquisitions exceeds $4.5M.
HCA delegable no lower than SCO
Approves use of a separate bid item for mobilization and preparatory work.
Oversees evaluation board functions for A&E contracts.
Determines that, in fixed-price A&E contracts, cost limitations are secondary to performance considerations and additional project funding can be expected, if necessary.

Approves a proposed personal services contract for services to be provided by individuals outside the U.S. and directly supports defense intelligence components or special operations command. Services must be urgent, cannot be obtained by other means, and are supporting DoD activities or programs outside the U.S.
May waive the 31.205-6(g)(6) cost allowability limitations on severance payments to foreign nationals that meet the conditions at 37.113-1(a)(1)-(2).
Determines if sufficient personnel with the requisite training and capabilities are available within the agency to perform the evaluation or analysis or proposals submitted for the acquisition.
Determines the services being acquired under contract with the local government are in DoD’s best interest.
Determines no commercial products or commercial services are suitable to meet the agency’s needs for information technology products or services in excess of the SAT.
Approves determination to pay the non-negotiated utility rates due to contract impasse.
Determines use of the area-wide contract for utility services is not advantageous to the Government.
Approves the delegation of additional functions to the CAO.
Approves the solicitation of voluntary refunds from a contractor.

Waives limitations of 243.204-70-2 (price ceiling); 243.204-70-3 (definitization schedule); and 243.204-70-4 (limitations on obligations) if necessary to support cont. ops or humanitarian/peacekeeping op.
Raises or lowers the $25 million contractor purchasing system review (CPSR) level if considered to be in the Government's best interest.
Determines installation or construction of Government property on contractor-owned real property in such a fashion as to become non-severable is necessary and in the Government’s interest.
Determines contractor will not be required to tag, label, or mark items that are to be in support of contingency operation or to facilitate defense against/recovery from NBCR attack.

Executes D&F concluding that it is more cost effective for the Government requiring activity to assign, mark, and register the unique item identification after delivery of an item acquired from a small business concern or a commercial product acquired under FAR part 12 or part 8 for an ACAT I program.

Approves a determination and findings concluding that it is more cost effective for the Government requiring activity to assign, mark, and register the unique item identification after delivery of an item acquired from a small business concern or a commercial product acquired under FAR part 12 or part 8 for all other programs.
Approves use of Government property for commercial use expected to exceed 25 percent of the total use of Government and commercial work performed.
Determines if the cost of calculating and tracking collateral savings will exceed the benefits to be derived.
Approves the use of 252.249-7000, Special Termination Costs in incrementally funded contract.

body.p: MP5301.601 (a)(i) Department of the Air Force Approval Authority Matrices : Authority to enter into, approve, or terminate Grants, Cooperative Agreements, and Other Transactions has been approved as shown below. This authority may be redelegated within the contracting functional chain of responsibility, in writing, under such terms, conditions, and limitations as may be deemed appropriate.
